Objective.evidence: We aimed to assess whether intravenous magnesium reduces postoperative pain, analgesic requirements, and hyperalgesia in adults receiving remifentanil-based anesthesia.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcomes were postoperative analgesic requirements and pain scores

Result_Outcome.evidence: Magnesium significantly decreased 24 h analgesic requirements (standardized mean difference [SMD] −1.51; 95% confidence interval [CI] −2.15 to −0.87; p < 0.0001) and pain scores (SMD −0.61; 95% CI −0.90 to −0.32; p < 0.0001)

Harms.evidence: without prolonging extubation or increasing hypotension/bradycardia risk
